intro: Halosarcia halocnemoides subsp. caudata, commonly known as the coastal bladderwrack, is a halophytic plant adapted to saline environments. It belongs to the family Corophyceae and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent stems and leaves. The plant exhibits a creeping growth habit, often forming dense mats on coastal soils. Its specialized cellular structures allow it to retain water and withstand high salt concentrations. This subspecies is typically found in intertidal zones and is an important component of coastal vegetation.
